summary: This is an FBI 302 interview summary of Alfredo Rodriguez, former house manager for Jeffrey Epstein. Rodriguez details his knowledge of underage girls, sexual activity, and financial payments at Epstein's Palm Beach home, and discusses his possession of a seized 'black bound book' and handwritten notes containing names and contact information.

persons.name: Alfredo Rodriguez
persons.role: Former House Manager for Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The interviewee who was employed by Jeffrey Epstein from 2004-2005. He describes observing underage girls, sexual activity, and his role in making payments to girls and cleaning up after massages. He also possessed the 'black bound book' and notes seized by agents.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Instructed Rodriguez not to discuss events at Epstein's home after he was fired. Also instructed him on whom to pay and in what amount from bank withdrawals.

persons.name: Jeffery Epstein
persons.context: Rodriguez's former employer. Rodriguez describes the sexual activity with underage girls, the presence of pornographic images, and Epstein's instructions for bank withdrawals to pay girls.

persons.name: Leslie Lnu
persons.context: A secretary in Epstein's New York organization whom Rodriguez contacted in 2005 for a letter of reference and again in early 2009 after receiving a subpoena.

persons.name: Jack Goldberger
persons.context: An attorney who contacted Rodriguez offering legal representation after Rodriguez alerted Epstein's organization about a subpoena. Rodriguez declined his representation.

persons.name: Luella Lnu
persons.context: The housekeeper who, along with Rodriguez, would clean the massage area, including massage tables, sex toys, handcuffs, and used condoms.

persons.name: Carolena Andreno
persons.context: Would contact girls whose names were listed in the black bound book on behalf of Epstein.

persons.name: Jean Luc Brunel
persons.context: Would bring girls to the house and sometimes arrange for girls to be flown in via commercial and private planes.

persons.name: Valsoun Lnu
persons.context: The house manager of Epstein's Paris, France property with whom Rodriguez discussed the sexual activity with young girls.

persons.name: Jerome Pierre
persons.context: The gardener at the Palm Beach county property whom Rodriguez believed was aware of the sexual activity with young girls at the house.

connections.description: Rodriguez was employed as the house manager for Epstein from 2004-2005.
Maxwell, as part of Epstein's organization, gave Rodriguez instructions regarding payments and later told him not to discuss events at the home.
Maxwell acted on Epstein's behalf, instructing staff like Rodriguez on operational matters such as payments.
Both were part of Epstein's staff; Andreno contacted girls from the black book on Epstein's behalf.
Both were involved in the operations at Epstein's home; Brunel brought girls to the house, which Rodriguez managed.
Brunel brought girls to Epstein's home and arranged travel for them, indicating a recruiting relationship.
Goldberger contacted Rodriguez offering legal representation after Rodriguez received a subpoena, but Rodriguez declined.

events.title: Seizure of Black Book and Notes
events.description: Agents seized a black bound book and handwritten notes from Alfredo Rodriguez.

events.title: Rodriguez Fired
events.description: Alfredo Rodriguez was fired from his position as house manager for Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Rodriguez Receives Subpoena
events.description: Rodriguez received a subpoena in civil litigation, prompting him to contact Epstein's secretary and later be contacted by attorney Jack Goldberger.

events.title: Hurricane Computer Repairs
events.description: After hurricanes, a computer technician from Ohio performed repair or maintenance on computers in Epstein's home.

events.title: Daily Massage Activities
events.description: Massages occurred twice per day at Epstein's home, after which Rodriguez and the housekeeper would clean massage tables, sex toys, handcuffs, and used condoms.

locations: Belvedere Road and U.S. Highway 1, Palm Beach county (taxi company area)
keyFacts: Alfredo Rodriguez, Epstein's former house manager, possessed a 'black bound book' and handwritten notes containing names and contact information, which were seized by agents in November 2009.
Rodriguez described seeing photographs of naked underage girls in collages in Epstein's home, naked underage girls at the pool, and pornographic images on computers in the house.
Rodriguez's duties included making cash payments to girls as instructed by Epstein or Ghislaine Maxwell, and cleaning sex toys, handcuffs, and used condoms from massage areas.
Associates Jean Luc Brunel and Carolena Andreno were involved in contacting and transporting girls to Epstein's home, with Brunel arranging flights.
Rodriguez believed other staff, including the gardener Jerome Pierre and the Paris house manager Valsoun Lnu, were aware of the sexual activity with young girls.
